  --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...> wrote:

  > This is specific to session beans, but you can also use it for
  > message-driven beans and BMP entity beans; only CMP entity beans
  > really need to be tested entirely in an EJB container.

  The general consensus among The Smart People seems to be that entity
  beans are a bad idea.  Why are you using them?  Have you considered
  alternatives?

  Dave


  [Steve Ketcham]

  I asked our team lead:

  <quote>
  This is an easy answer that he'll probably tell me to develop our own row
locking scheme :)
  We essentially use entity beans to control writes to our database to avoid
conflict from multiple applications using the same data.

  We also use the data classes (info objects in ITI) to avoid too many calls
to the getter/setter methods of the beans.  The bean itself is never exposed
to the client, but the data object is.
  </quote>

  What do you recomend and is there a "Smart People" web site :) ?
